intro: Dianthus barati, commonly known as the Armenian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant colors and compact growth habit. Dianthus barati is also valued for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
